required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: A Study of Clofarabine in Combination With Etoposide and Cyclophosphamide in Children With Acute Leukemias.
clinical_study.official_title: A Phase 1/2 Dose-Escalation Study of Clofarabine in Combination With Etoposide and Cyclophosphamide in Pediatric Patients With Refractory or Relapsed Acute Leukemias.

brief_summary.textblock:
Clofarabine (injection) is approved by the Food and Drug Administration (FDA) for the treatment of pediatric patients 1 to 21 years old with relapsed or refractory acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) who have had at least 2 prior treatment regimens. This use is based on the induction of complete responses. Randomized trials demonstrating increased survival or other clinical benefit have not been conducted.
The purpose of the phase 1 portion of this study was to determine if clofarabine added to a combination of etoposide and cyclophosphamide is safe in children with relapsed or refractory acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) or acute myelogenous leukemia (AML). The purpose of the phase 2 portion of the study was to measure the effectiveness of the combination therapy in children with ALL.

primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 42 (Phase 1 portion of study)
primary_outcome.description: The MTD was to be the highest dose level of clofarabine in combination with etoposide and cyclophosphamide that caused <= 1 of 6 participants to experience a dose limiting toxicity (DLT) with the next higher dose level having at least 2 of 3 or 2 of 6 participants experiencing a DLT. The MTD would be used as the recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D). If the MTD could not be determined, then the target dose of clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 as taken by Cohort 5 was to become the RP2D. The rating scale used is 0 = not the MTD, 1 = the MTD.

primary_outcome.measure: Participants With Dose Limiting Toxicity in Phase 1
primary_outcome.time_frame: Up to Day 42 (Phase 1 portion of study)
primary_outcome.description: The number of participants in each cohort that had dose limiting toxicity is summarized. Toxicities were reviewed by an independent Data Safety Monitoring Board (DSMB) who determined if additional participants should be added to the cohort and the criteria for escalating to the next cohort.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving A Response Over the First Two Treatment Cycles in Phase 2
primary_outcome.description: Response categories 1) complete remission (CR): without circulating blasts or extramedullary disease, bone marrow (BM) with <5% blasts, and platelet (plt)/ANC recovery: ≥75/ ≥0.75 [x 10^9/L] 2) CR in absence of plt recovery (CRp): plt ≥20 to <75 x 10^9/L 3) partial remission (PR): no circulating blasts, appearance of normal hematopoietic progenitors, and either a BM with ≥5% and ≤25% blasts with recovery of plts/ANC or a BM with <5% blasts not meeting CR/CRp definition 4) Overall remission (OR): CR+CRp 5) Any response: CR+CRp+PR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) in Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 9.5 months (Phase 1 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with AEs that occurred during treatment and follow-up period (45 days after last cycle). Drug-related AEs and SAEs were followed until resolved or mutually agreed by the investigator and Genzyme to discontinue reporting. AEs were classified by the investigator according to severity (graded using National Cancer Institute [NCI] Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [CTCAE] version 3.0) and relationship to study drug. The severity scale is: > Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death related to AE

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants Achieving A Response Over the First Two Treatment Cycles in Phase 1
secondary_outcome.description: Response categories 1) complete remission (CR): without circulating blasts or extramedullary disease, bone marrow (BM) with <5% blasts, and platelet (plt)/ANC recovery: ALL ≥75/ ≥0.75 [x 10^9/L]; AML ≥100/ ≥1.0 [x 10^9/L] 2) CR in absence of plt recovery (CRp): ALL plt ≥20 to <75 x 10^9/L; AML plt ≥20 to <100 x 10^9/L 3) partial remission (PR): no circulating blasts, appearance of normal hematopoietic progenitors, and either a BM with ≥5% and ≤25% blasts with recovery of plts/ANC or a BM with <5% blasts not meeting CR/CRp definition 4) Overall remission (OR): CR+CRp 5) Any response: CR+CRp+PR.

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Remission for Participants Who Had a Response in Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 8 weeks (Phase 1 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: The weeks between start of intervention and remission as assessed by the investigator in Phase 1. Participants who had a complete remission (CR) or complete remission with the absence of total platelet recovery (CRp) are included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan Meier Estimate of Duration of Remission (DOR) for Participants Who Achieved Overall Remission (OR) in Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (Phase 1 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response is the time from the first objective measurement of complete response (CR) or complete response with the absence of total platelet recovery (CRp) to the date of first objective documentation of disease relapse or death due to any cause, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan Meier Estimates of Event-free Survival (EFS) for Participants in Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (Phase 1 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Event-free survival (EFS) is defined as the time from date of first administration of study interventions until the earliest of the following: date of death or date of first response assessment confirming relapse or date of final response assessment which fails to confirm response, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With 4-month Event Free Survival in Phase 1
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with event-free survival at four months post first dose of therapy. A participant is considered event-free if at month 4 they have not died or had a response assessment confirming a relapse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan Meier Estimates of Overall Survival (OS) for Participants in Phase 1
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (Phase 1 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from date of first administration of study interventions until date of death, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Summary of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) in Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 9.5 months (Phase 2 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with AEs that occurred during treatment and follow-up period (45 days after last cycle). Drug-related AEs and SAEs were followed until resolved or mutually agreed by the investigator and Genzyme to discontinue reporting. AEs were classified by the investigator according to severity (graded using National Cancer Institute [NCI] Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [CTCAE] version 3.0) and relationship to study drug. The severity scale is: > Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death related to AE

secondary_outcome.measure: Time to Remission for Participants Who Had a Response in Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: up to 8 weeks (Phase 2 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: The weeks between start of intervention and remission as assessed by the investigator in Phase 2. Participants who had a complete remission (CR) or complete remission with the absence of total platelet recovery (CRp) are included.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan Meier Estimate of Duration of Remission (DOR) for Participants Who Achieved Overall Remission (OR) in Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (Phase 2 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Duration of response is the time from the first objective measurement of complete response (CR) or complete response with the absence of total platelet recovery (CRp) to the date of first objective documentation of disease relapse or death due to any cause, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan Meier Estimates of Event-free Survival (EFS) for Participants in Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (Phase 2 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Event-free survival (EFS) is defined as the time from date of first administration of study interventions until the earliest of the following: date of death or date of first response assessment confirming relapse or date of final response assessment which fails to confirm response, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With 4-month Event Free Survival in Phase 2
secondary_outcome.description: Number of participants with event-free survival at four months post first dose of therapy. A participant is considered event-free if at month 4 they have not died or had a response assessment confirming a relapse.

secondary_outcome.measure: Kaplan Meier Estimates of Overall Survival (OS) for Participants in Phase 2
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (Phase 2 portion of study)
secondary_outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from date of first administration of study interventions until date of death, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.

arm_group.description: Phase 1: escalating dosage of the three drugs delivered intravenously. Clofarabine dosage from 20-40 mg/m^2, etoposide dosage from 75-100 mg/m^2, cyclophosphamide dosage from 340-440 mg/m^2. Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously

intervention.description: Clofarabine 20‑40 mg/m²/day 2 hour intravenous (IV) infusion daily for 5 days of a 28 day cycle as the first of the three IV interventions administered. Maximum of 8 cycles given in both the phase 1 and phase 2 study periods.
Etoposide 75-100 mg/m²/day 2 hour intravenous (IV) infusion daily for 5 days of a 28 day cycle following clofarabine therapy. Maximum of 8 cycles given in both the phase 1 and phase 2 study periods.

Cyclophosphamide 340‑440 mg/m²/day as 30-60 minute intravenous (IV) infusion daily for 5 days of a 28 day cycle following the other two interventions. Maximum of 8 cycles given in both the phase 1 and phase 2 study periods.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- NOTE: the following eligibility criteria were applicable to acute lymphoblastic leukemia (ALL) and acute myelogenous leukemia (AML) patients for the Phase 1 portion of this study, and to ALL patients for the Phase 2 portion of the study (only ALL patients were allowed in the Phase 2 portion of the study).
- ALL with > 25% blasts in bone marrow; AML with ≥ 5% blasts in bone marrow; ALL and AML patients may have extramedullary disease
- Karnofsky Performance Status ≥ 50 for patients > 10 years old; Lansky Performance Status ≥ 50 for patients ≤ 10 years old
- Prior therapy: AML: 1-2 prior induction regimens and ≤ 1 hematopoietic stem cell transplant (HSCT); ALL: 1-3 prior induction regimens
- Adequate liver, renal, pancreatic, and cardiac function
- Have received no prior HSCT (study amended in Phase 2 to exclude patients with prior HSCT)
Exclusion Criteria:
- NOTE: the following eligibility criteria were applicable to ALL and AML patients for the Phase 1 portion of this study, and to ALL patients for the Phase 2 portion of the study (only ALL patients were allowed in the Phase 2 portion of the study).
- Burkitt's leukemia
- Previous treatment with clofarabine
- Uncontrolled systemic fungal, bacterial or other infection and 48 hrs negative blood cultures required for patients with a history of fever within 3 days of enrollment
- Active CNS involvement (i.e., should be CNS1 or CNS2)
- Inadequate time since last therapy: ≤ 14 days since last cytotoxic chemotherapy; ≤ 7 days since last biologic therapy; ≤ 14 days since last monoclonal antibody therapy
- Have received prior HSCT (study amended in Phase 2 to exclude patients with prior HSCT)
- Pregnant or lactating
- Have tested positive for hepatitis B or hepatitis C infection or history of cirrhosis

facility.name: University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center

group.title: Clofarabine, Etoposide, Cyclophosphamide
group.description: Phase 1: escalating dosage of the three drugs delivered intravenously. Clofarabine dosage from 20-40 mg/m^2, etoposide dosage from 75-100 mg/m^2, cyclophosphamide dosage from 340-440 mg/m^2. > Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously

measure.title: Percent Leukemic Blast Cells
measure.description: Percent of leukemic blast cells based on bone marrow aspirate. The two study phases were not designed to be reported in the aggregate.

measure.title: Absolute Neutrophil Counts
measure.description: The two study phases were not designed to be reported in the aggregate.

measure.title: White Blood Cell Counts
measure.description: The two study phases were not designed to be reported in the aggregate.

measure.title: Immunophenotype
measure.description: Applies to acute lymphoblastic leukemic (ALL) participants only. Acute myelogenous leukemic (AML) participants are not included. The two study phases were not designed to be reported in the aggregate.

measure.title: Count of Previous Anti-Leukemic (non-transplant) Treatment Regimens
measure.description: The two study phases were not designed to be reported in the aggregate.

measure.title: Participants with Previous Anti-Leukemic Transplant Regimens
measure.description: The two study phases were not designed to be reported in the aggregate.

measure.title: Participants Who Were Refractory to the Most Recent Previous Anti-Leukemic Treatment
measure.description: The answer "Yes" indicates the number of participants who were refractory (unresponsive) to the most recent anti-leukemic treatment. The answer "No" represents participants who were not refractory. The two study phases were not designed to be reported in the aggregate.

measure.title: Participant Rating Using the Karnofsky/Lansky Performance Status Scale
measure.description: Baseline performance was rating using either the Karnofsky Performance Scale for participants greater than 10 years old, or the Lansky Performance Scale for participants 10 years or younger. Both scales range from 0-100 with 0 indicating dead or unresponsive and 100 indicating normal performance. The two study phases were not designed to be reported in the aggregate.

outcome.title: Maximum Tolerated Dose (MTD) in Phase 1
outcome.description: The MTD was to be the highest dose level of clofarabine in combination with etoposide and cyclophosphamide that caused <= 1 of 6 participants to experience a dose limiting toxicity (DLT) with the next higher dose level having at least 2 of 3 or 2 of 6 participants experiencing a DLT. The MTD would be used as the recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D). If the MTD could not be determined, then the target dose of clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 as taken by Cohort 5 was to become the RP2D. The rating scale used is 0 = not the MTD, 1 = the MTD.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving A Response Over the First Two Treatment Cycles in Phase 1
outcome.description: Response categories 1) complete remission (CR): without circulating blasts or extramedullary disease, bone marrow (BM) with <5% blasts, and platelet (plt)/ANC recovery: ALL ≥75/ ≥0.75 [x 10^9/L]; AML ≥100/ ≥1.0 [x 10^9/L] 2) CR in absence of plt recovery (CRp): ALL plt ≥20 to <75 x 10^9/L; AML plt ≥20 to <100 x 10^9/L 3) partial remission (PR): no circulating blasts, appearance of normal hematopoietic progenitors, and either a BM with ≥5% and ≤25% blasts with recovery of plts/ANC or a BM with <5% blasts not meeting CR/CRp definition 4) Overall remission (OR): CR+CRp 5) Any response: CR+CRp+PR.

group.description: Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously

measure.title: Percentage of Participants Achieving A Response Over the First Two Treatment Cycles in Phase 2
measure.description: Response categories 1) complete remission (CR): without circulating blasts or extramedullary disease, bone marrow (BM) with <5% blasts, and platelet (plt)/ANC recovery: ≥75/ ≥0.75 [x 10^9/L] 2) CR in absence of plt recovery (CRp): plt ≥20 to <75 x 10^9/L 3) partial remission (PR): no circulating blasts, appearance of normal hematopoietic progenitors, and either a BM with ≥5% and ≤25% blasts with recovery of plts/ANC or a BM with <5% blasts not meeting CR/CRp definition 4) Overall remission (OR): CR+CRp 5) Any response: CR+CRp+PR.

outcome.title: Summary of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) in Phase 2
outcome.description: Number of participants with AEs that occurred during treatment and follow-up period (45 days after last cycle). Drug-related AEs and SAEs were followed until resolved or mutually agreed by the investigator and Genzyme to discontinue reporting. AEs were classified by the investigator according to severity (graded using National Cancer Institute [NCI] Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [CTCAE] version 3.0) and relationship to study drug. The severity scale is: > Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death related to AE
outcome.time_frame: Up to 9.5 months (Phase 2 portion of study)

group.title: Phase 2: Clofarabine, Etoposide, Cyclophosphamide
group.description: Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously

measure.title: Summary of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) in Phase 2
measure.description: Number of participants with AEs that occurred during treatment and follow-up period (45 days after last cycle). Drug-related AEs and SAEs were followed until resolved or mutually agreed by the investigator and Genzyme to discontinue reporting. AEs were classified by the investigator according to severity (graded using National Cancer Institute [NCI] Common Terminology Criteria for Adverse Events [CTCAE] version 3.0) and relationship to study drug. The severity scale is: > Grade 1=Mild, Grade 2=Moderate, Grade 3=Severe, Grade 4=Life-threatening or disabling, Grade 5=Death related to AE

class.title: At least one AE related to clofarabine
At least one serious AE related to clofarabine
AE with the worst grade of: 1
AE with the worst grade of: 2
AE with the worst grade of: 3

outcome.title: Time to Remission for Participants Who Had a Response in Phase 2
outcome.description: The weeks between start of intervention and remission as assessed by the investigator in Phase 2. Participants who had a complete remission (CR) or complete remission with the absence of total platelet recovery (CRp) are included.
outcome.time_frame: up to 8 weeks (Phase 2 portion of study)
outcome.population: Participants in phase 2 who had an overall remission.

group.title: Phase 2: Clofarabine, Etoposide, Cyclophosphamide
group.description: Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously.

measure.title: Time to Remission for Participants Who Had a Response in Phase 2
measure.description: The weeks between start of intervention and remission as assessed by the investigator in Phase 2. Participants who had a complete remission (CR) or complete remission with the absence of total platelet recovery (CRp) are included.
measure.population: Participants in phase 2 who had an overall remission.

outcome.title: Kaplan Meier Estimate of Duration of Remission (DOR) for Participants Who Achieved Overall Remission (OR) in Phase 2
outcome.description: Duration of response is the time from the first objective measurement of complete response (CR) or complete response with the absence of total platelet recovery (CRp) to the date of first objective documentation of disease relapse or death due to any cause, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (Phase 2 portion of study)
outcome.population: Phase 2 participants who achieved overall remission. Data are censored at date of last known follow-up visit.

group.title: Phase 2: Clofarabine, Etoposide, Cyclophosphamide
group.description: Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously

measure.title: Kaplan Meier Estimate of Duration of Remission (DOR) for Participants Who Achieved Overall Remission (OR) in Phase 2
measure.description: Duration of response is the time from the first objective measurement of complete response (CR) or complete response with the absence of total platelet recovery (CRp) to the date of first objective documentation of disease relapse or death due to any cause, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.
measure.population: Phase 2 participants who achieved overall remission. Data are censored at date of last known follow-up visit.

measurement_list.measurement: NA = not estimable because values are mostly censored. Participants with longer DORs have not relapsed, progressed, or died, therefore the upper confidence limit cannot be estimated.

outcome.title: Kaplan Meier Estimates of Event-free Survival (EFS) for Participants in Phase 2
outcome.description: Event-free survival (EFS) is defined as the time from date of first administration of study interventions until the earliest of the following: date of death or date of first response assessment confirming relapse or date of final response assessment which fails to confirm response, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (Phase 2 portion of study)
outcome.population: All phase 2 participants. Data are censored at date of last known follow-up visit.

group.title: Phase 2: Clofarabine, Etoposide, Cyclophosphamide
group.description: Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously

measure.title: Kaplan Meier Estimates of Event-free Survival (EFS) for Participants in Phase 2
measure.description: Event-free survival (EFS) is defined as the time from date of first administration of study interventions until the earliest of the following: date of death or date of first response assessment confirming relapse or date of final response assessment which fails to confirm response, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.
measure.population: All phase 2 participants. Data are censored at date of last known follow-up visit.

outcome.title: Number of Participants With 4-month Event Free Survival in Phase 2
outcome.description: Number of participants with event-free survival at four months post first dose of therapy. A participant is considered event-free if at month 4 they have not died or had a response assessment confirming a relapse.

group.title: Phase 2: Clofarabine, Etoposide, Cyclophosphamide
group.description: Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously.

measure.title: Number of Participants With 4-month Event Free Survival in Phase 2
measure.description: Number of participants with event-free survival at four months post first dose of therapy. A participant is considered event-free if at month 4 they have not died or had a response assessment confirming a relapse.

outcome.title: Kaplan Meier Estimates of Overall Survival (OS) for Participants in Phase 2
outcome.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from date of first administration of study interventions until date of death, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.
outcome.time_frame: Up to 2 years (Phase 2 portion of study)
outcome.population: All phase 2 participants. Data are censored at date of last known follow-up visit.

group.title: Phase 2: Clofarabine, Etoposide, Cyclophosphamide
group.description: Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously

measure.title: Kaplan Meier Estimates of Overall Survival (OS) for Participants in Phase 2
measure.description: Overall survival is defined as the time from date of first administration of study interventions until date of death, plus one day. For summary purposes, results are presented as weeks.
measure.population: All phase 2 participants. Data are censored at date of last known follow-up visit.

reported_events.time_frame: Treatment emergent adverse experiences collected in Phase 1 from day 1 up to 9.5 months. Phase 2 also lasted up to 9.5 months and started after Phase 1.
reported_events.desc: In the event a single participant has experienced both a serious and a non-serious form of the same adverse event term, the individual has been included in the numerator ("number of affected participants") of adverse event tables.

group.title: Phase 1 - Cohort 1
group.description: Participants were treated with clofarabine 20 mg/m^2, etoposide 75 mg/m^2, and cyclophosphamide 340 mg/m^2.

group.title: Phase 1 - Cohort 2
group.description: Participants were treated with clofarabine 20 mg/m^2, etoposide 75 mg/m^2, and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2.

group.title: Phase 1 - Cohort 3
group.description: Participants were treated with clofarabine 20 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2, and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2.

group.title: Phase 1 - Cohort 4
group.description: Participants were treated with clofarabine 30 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2, and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2.

group.title: Phase 1 - Cohort 5
group.description: Participants were treated with clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2, and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2.

group.title: Phase 1 - Total
group.description: All participants from Cohorts 1-5 in Phase 1

group.description: Phase 2: The recommended phase 2 doses (RP2D) were clofarabine 40 mg/m^2, etoposide 100 mg/m^2 and cyclophosphamide 440 mg/m^2 delivered intravenously.

category.title: Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)
Neoplasms benign, malignant and unspecified (incl cysts and polyps)

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: In multi-site studies, PI can publish after Genzyme publishes or 18 months after study completion. PI gives Genzyme a draft 60 days before publication. Genzyme can ask that confidential information be removed, and can defer publication another 60 days upon notifying PI that it will file a patent application on inventions contained in the draft.
